intro: Delphinium chinense album, commonly known as the white Chinese larkspur, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It features tall, sparsely branched stems that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. The plant produces showy, blue to purple flowers arranged in racemes, with five petals and a distinctive spurred lower petal. Its leaves are compound, with lance-shaped leaflets that are hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. Delphinium chinense album thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes.
